result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stevie R Sullivan

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
May have letter contact with co-defendant regarding medical conditions regarding unborn child. Letters may be monitored by jail/prison staff.

3:21 PM Defendant Stevie R Sullivan in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Stevie R Sullivan.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jakobson is requesting that defendant be allowed to have contact by letter regarding unborn child. They do not object to prison/jail reviewing all letters.
Attorney Zima is objecting to the parties having contact and states reasons why.
Court will allow parties to communicate by letter regarding unborn child.
Final pre-trial on August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on July 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stevie R Sullivan in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared by phone for Stevie R Sullivan.
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Stevie R Sullivan not in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared by phone for Stevie R Sullivan. 

Warrant ordered.  Body only.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Stevie R Sullivan in court. 
Court questions defendant regarding non-representation. She states she applied to Public Defender and is eligible and will appoint counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
Luke Maher is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zima. He is a police officer with the Nekoosa Police Department. On 12/15/21, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Nekoosa, Wood County, regarding a possible overdose. He met with individuals including defendant. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Defendant was unresponsive until Narcan was administered. He found a tin foil pipe with a substance in it. The substance tested positive for THC. Attorney Zima asks Court take judicial notice of Wood County case 20CF760, a prior drug conviction.
Court finds probable cause the a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.  $2500
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.
1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Stevie R Sullivan appeared in court. Transferred to Br 3.
10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Stevie R Sullivan not in court.   Warrant ordered. Body only.
